GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 17, 2025
Andrea Melendrez
ADRIAN GROUP HOME
190 PLEASANT KNOLL DR,
ADRIAN, MI, 49221-1220
Re: License #: CI460403164
SI #: 2025SIC0000645
Dear Andrea Melendrez:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan must be completed and routed in CWLM. If you desire technical assistance in
addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
***This report contains sexually explicit information***
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000645
Special Investigation Intake Date: May 5, 2025
License #: CI460403164
Licensee Group Organization: LHS Family and Youth Services
Licensee Designee: Catherine Zawisza
Chief Administrator: Andrea Melendrez
Agency Name: ADRIAN GROUP HOME
Agency Address: 190 PLEASANT KNOLL DR
ADRIAN, MI 49221-1220
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 02/12/2026
Capacity: 10
II. METHODOLOGY

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section Program statement
Description (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Between February 2025 and April 2025, a staff member lacked
boundaries with youth at the home. The staff member was in a
youth's room with lights off and the door closed. The staff
member has been e-mailing this youth since February 2025.
There were numerous notes found in the youth's room from the
staff member. The staff member was terminated in April for
violating the electronic policy.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on May 5, 2025. Staff 2
reported she did not work a lot with Staff 1 but heard of these
boundary concerns. She reported Staff 3 reported to her about the
concern of Staff 1 going into Youth A’s bedroom with the bedroom
lights off. Staff 3 did tell Staff 2 that she reported this information
to Administrator 1. Staff 2 reported staff are to not go into a
youth’s bedroom with the lights off. She reported Staff 4 reported
to her Staff 1 and asked Staff 4 to set up a FaceTime for Staff 1
and Youth A after she was let go from the facility. Staff 2 reported
Staff 1 was let go from the facility because she allowed Youth A to
use her personal tablet that had full internet access in his room
alone. She reported there were concerns with Staff 1 emailing
Youth A on his school email address. Staff 2 reported she had
found notes in Youth A’s bedroom room from Staff 1 that were
encouraging him to do well but also found a note telling him to
dress his best for dinner and she would as well. This note also
had a heart at the end of the note where Staff 1 signed her name.
2

Staff 2 reported there was no confirmation of any sexual abuse
going on but there were some true concerns of Staff 1 crossing
boundaries with Youth A.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at his school on May 7,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported
he had a positive relationship with Staff 1. He reported that she
was terminated because she had poor boundaries with him. When
asked to explain more, Youth A reported Staff 1 would give him
her personal tablet to play games on it which is not allowed. Youth
A reported Staff 1 would help him stay calm and would always be
there for him when he needed to talk. He reported they never had
a sexual or romantic relationship. Youth A was asked if staff could
go into his bedroom and close the door, Youth A reported staff are
not allowed to be in his room with the door closed. He reported
Staff 1 would come into his room near bedtime, but the door was
always open. Youth A reported it was never a secret and stated
that other staff could hear and see them. When asked about
writing notes, Youth A reported Staff 1 would write him notes of
encouragement, and he would hang them on the walls. He denied
Staff 1 ever making promises to him that he could come stay with
her when he leaves the facility. Youth A reported he has not talked
to Staff 1 since she was let go from the facility. When asked about
emailing her, Youth A admitted he did email Staff 1’s personal
email when she left to get the login information for one of his
games. He reported Staff 1 did provide her personal email to him.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face in the community on May
29, 2026, by MDHHS Worker, this consultant was available via
phone. Staff 1 reported she was terminated from employment at
the facility due to reported favoritism and boundary concerns. She
reported back in January 2025 she asked Therapist, Administrator
1 and Administrator 3 for help with how to set appropriate
boundaries and work with the youth. Staff 1 reported she was
provided some helpful feedback and followed more so what other
staff were doing. When asked if staff are allowed in the youth’s
bedroom alone, she reported that it is a gray area because
sometimes staff would go into a youth’s room to process with
them. Staff 1 did confirm that the door should not be closed if a
staff is in the youth’s bedroom. She reported this did happen with
her before where she went into Youth A’s bedroom and the door
was shut but it was because he was talking to her about his past
trauma and was emotional. Staff 1 reported all they did in the
bedroom was talk. She reported she did write encouraging letters
to all of the youth and denied ever telling Youth A to wear his best
outfit to dinner. Staff 1 confirmed staff are not allowed to share
3

personal contact information with the youth. She reported Youth A
did email her before on her personal email but does not know how
he got her personal email. When asked about allowing youth to
use staff’s personal electronics, Staff 1 reported this was a gray
area as she has seen other staff allow this to happen, so she
thought it was okay. She reported that she also received
permission from Administrator 3 to bring her in gaming system for
the youth. Staff 1 reported Youth A would be very touchy and
would want to hug her all the time. She reported the facility never
told her specifically if hugging was allowed and reported she did
allow Youth A to hug her. Staff 1 reported Youth A would be
redirected to maintain appropriate personal space and confirmed
he did lay his head in Staff 1’s lap. Staff 1 reported Youth A had
many behavioral problems where he would become more
physically aggressive at times. She reported she had a positive
relationship with him so other staff would just tell her that she can
deal with him to make the shift easier. Staff 1 reported she was
trying to do her best to keep him calm. She denied ever having
any inappropriate boundaries with him but did feel like she was set
up for failure because she was a new staff trying to figure out how
to keep him calm on her own. Staff 1 denied ever asking to talk to
Youth A after she was terminated from the facility.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
May 7, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Administrator 1 reported Staff 1 was terminated from the facility
due to concerns of favoritism and not following the electronic
policy. She reported Staff 1 was receiving coaching due to
showing favoritism to Youth A. Administrator 1 reported
Administrator 2 had found Staff 1 providing Youth A her personal
tablet, which allowed him to have full internet access, which is
against their electronics policy. This resulted in Staff 1 being
terminated from the facility. Administrator 1 reported staff at the
facility did report concerns that Staff 1 was quick to forgive Youth
A when he was having negative behaviors. She reported there
were concerns that Staff 1 would go into Youth A’s room with the
door shut and the lights off. Administrator 1 reported Administrator
3 did follow up about this behavior. She reported Staff 4 was
standing outside Youth A’s door when this occurred. It was
reported Staff 1 went into Youth A’s room with the door closed on
March 23rd and March 25th, and Administrator 3 provided
coaching on March 26th about this behavior. Administrator 1
reported that staff should not be in a youth’s bedroom with the
door closed and lights turned off. She reported Staff 1 was going
to graduate school during the time she was working at the facility
to become a counselor. Administrator 1 reported that it felt that
4

Staff 1 was trying to “save” Youth A and continue to counsel him.
Staff 1 had been directed to allow the therapist at the facility to do
the therapy and was provided coaching on boundaries. When
asked about note writing, Administrator 1 reported that there is no
strict policy that staff cannot write notes, and the reported notes
are just words of encouragement. Administrator 1 reported that
Staff 4 did tell her that Staff 1 wanted to talk with Youth A after she
was terminated from employment. She reported that at that point,
staff were all made aware that Staff 1 was not to have any contact
with any youth at the facility or come to the facility. Staff were
given directions to notify the supervision team if this occurs.
Administrator 1 reported she did contact the school, which when
the school found that Youth A had sent an email to Staff 1 via her
personal email. His email address has been disabled.
Administrator 1 reported that staff should not be sending personal
contact information with the youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 7,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported
Staff 1 made her feel uncomfortable when she worked with her.
When asked to explain more, Staff 3 reported Staff 1 had
boundary issues with Youth A. She reported that Staff 1 would
allow Youth A to use her personal tablet all the time, which is not
allowed. Staff 3 reported that Staff 1 would go into Youth A’s
bedroom at night with the door closed and lights turned off. She
reported she reported this to Administrator 3 on March 22 and
March 23 about Staff 1 being in the room with the door closed.
Staff 3 reported she had Staff 5 go into the room at one point. She
reported on March 25, 2025, that Staff 1 did go into Youth A’s
room again, but this time left the door open. Staff 3 reported that
Staff 1 would spend all her time with Youth A and would ignore the
other youth. She reported that Staff 1 would spend her personal
money on Youth A, which is not allowed. Staff 3 reported that
Youth A was always hugging Staff 1 and was caught lying his
head on her lap when they sat on the couch. She reported she
just felt Staff 1 was continuing to enable Youth A’s negative
behaviors and allowed him to do whatever he wanted. Staff 3
reported that Staff 1 would write notes to Youth A, and he would
hang them in his room. She reported she has written encouraging
notes to the youth but she does it for all the youth where Staff 1
would only do it for Youth A. Staff 3 reported she has been trained
to maintain appropriate professional boundaries with the youth,
never buy things for the youth with her personal money, and
should never go into a bedroom with the door closed.
5

Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 7,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported
that Staff 1 was terminated from the facility because she had poor
boundaries with Youth A. She reported that Staff 1 was very
attached to Youth A and wanted to see him do well. Staff 4
reported that Youth A would always hug Staff 1. She reported she
never saw any inappropriate touching going on. Staff 4 reported
she has heard that Staff 1 would go into Youth A’s bedroom with
the door closed but never witnessed that. She reported she
witnessed Staff 1 go into Youth A’s bedroom with the door open
and would sit on his floor and play music while he was falling
asleep. Staff 4 reported staff are not allowed to go into a youth’s
bedroom with the door shut. She reported that Staff 1 would also
leave notes for all the youth with encouraging words in them. Staff
4 reported she is unaware of Staff 1 buying things for Youth A with
her personal money and denied Staff 1 asking her to talk to Youth
A after she was terminated. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 did ask her
what her thoughts were if she allowed Youth A to come live with
her when he turns 18 years old. She reported Staff 1 never talked
to Youth A about this idea, but just Staff 4’s opinion on the idea.
Staff 4 reported she does not feel this is appropriate.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 7,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported
that he is aware of Staff 1 being terminated from working at the
facility because she allowed Youth A to use her personal table. He
reported he did work with Staff 1, but did not have a lot of
concerns with her, besides, she is a newer staff member. Staff 5
reported one day he did open Youth A’s bedroom door when Staff
1 was in there with the door shut and lights off. He reported Staff 1
was coming out of the bedroom when he opened the door. Staff 5
reported he told Staff 1 that she cannot be in a youth’s bedroom
with the door shut and lights off.
Staff 6 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 7,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 6 reported he
worked with Staff 1 often as her team leader. He reported he
helped with coaching her to maintain appropriate professional
boundaries with the youth. Staff 6 reported this is the first time
Staff 1 has ever worked in a facility, and they want to help the
youth. He reported Staff 1 became very emotionally attached to
Youth A because of the trauma he had experienced. Staff 6
reported he caught Staff 1 trying to give Youth A her personal
tablet to use, but he redirected the situation. He reported Youth A
likes to be touchier, where he is always grabbing on to staff,
hugging staff, or sitting close to staff. Staff 6 reported he had to
6

redirect Youth A from being too close to Staff 1. He reported a
couple of times he saw Staff 1 go into Youth A’s bedroom around
bedtime, where the door would be open, and she would be sitting
on the floor. Staff 6 reported he provided her feedback that she
should be in the hallway so that she is in view of the camera for
both her safety and the youth’s safety. He reported Staff 1 had a
hard time with redirecting Youth A and would always look for
support for holding Youth A accountable.
Administrator 2 was interviewed via phone on May 16, 2025,
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Administrator 2 reported
she was working on April 8, 2025, when she noticed Staff 1 looked
like she had something hiding in her pants that was a square
shape. When she went to talk with Administrator 3 about it, Staff 1
no longer had the square-shaped object in her pants.
Administrator 2 reported she noticed Staff 1 had a square-shaped
object in her pants again when Staff 1 went to Youth A’s room.
This is when she confirmed Staff 1 had provided Youth A with her
personal tablet. Administrator 2 reported she addressed this
concern with Staff 1 and sent her home for the night. The next
day, Staff 1 was ultimately terminated due to the previous
boundary concerns with Youth A and not following through with
the verbal warning that was provided. Administrator 2 reported
that the facility is constantly training staff about appropriate
boundaries and support to provide to the youth. She reported the
day after Staff 1 was terminated, Staff 4 had come up to
Administrator 2, reported that Staff 1 had asked her to pull Youth
A aside so she could video call him. Administrator 2 reported that
she thanked Staff 4 for this information and stated that it is not
allowed. She reported that she personally called Staff 1 about this
and stated that she is not allowed to have any contact with the
youth at the facility anymore, and if she does, the police will be
notified. Administrator 2 reported she was unaware of the notes or
Youth A lying in Staff 1’s lap until post-termination of Staff 1.
Administrator 3 was interviewed via phone on May 16, 2025,
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Administrator 3 reported
he worked closely with Staff 1 as she was a young staff member
that has never worked in a residential facility. He reported Staff 3
had contacted him on March 23 and March 25 with the concerns
of Staff 1 being in Youth A’s room with the lights off. He reported
he talked with Staff 1 about this behavior not being allowed on
3/26, and she at first was defensive, but was able to see the
reason why the boundary needs to be put in place. Administrator 3
reported Staff 3 had contacted him again on March 31st about
Staff 1 being in Youth A’s room again. He reported on April 1st,
7

that he met with Staff 1 and provided her a verbal warning at this
time, and she was not allowed to be one-on-one with Youth A. He
reported that he does not believe Staff 1 had any ill intentions with
her relationship with Youth A, and it was more so that she felt that
she could save him. Administrator 3 reported Staff 1 was in a
program to become of therapist and had to be reminded that her
role is not a therapist but a direct care worker and to make sure to
not blur that line. He reported that the staff are constantly trained
on the importance of being in view of the camera and maintaining
professional boundaries with the youth. Administrator 3 reported
he was not aware of the note or Youth A lying his head on Staff
1’s lap. He reported he was also unaware of the personal items
being bought for Youth A.
Therapist was interviewed via phone on May 16, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Therapist reported she is
aware of Staff 1’s termination from the facility due to allowing
Youth A to use her personal tablet. She reported Youth A had a
good relationship with Staff 1 and would ask for her to come sit in
on some therapy sessions. Therapist reported this is not
uncommon for the youth to have their preferred staff come into
sessions at times. She reported she does not work on the floor
much and notes she saw any inappropriate behaviors between
Staff 1 and Youth A. Therapist reported that Youth A never
reported to her any concerns about his relationship with Staff 1.
She reported she is not fully aware of what staff are trained on
about boundaries with the youth.
Administrator 4 was interviewed via phone on May 16, 2025,
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Administrator 4 reported
she was aware of the disciplinary actions that were provided to
Staff 1. She reported she has been at the facility multiple times
and never saw any concerning behavior. Administrator 4 reported
that Therapist did have a meeting with Youth A about his poor
boundaries with Staff 1 and that he is manipulating her to get what
he wants. She reported all staff under the facility’s license are
constantly trained on appropriate boundaries and relationships
with the youth. This also includes not providing a youth with
personal technology or staff personal contact information.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 29,
2026, by MDHHS Worker, this consultant was available via
phone. Youth B reported he liked living at the facility and does not
have any concerns. He reported Staff 1 was fired from working at
the facility but does not know why she was fired. Youth B reported
Staff 1 was nice staff and would bring in her gaming system for
8

the youth to play with. He reported Staff 1 would sit by Youth A’s
door often and talk with him. Youth B confirmed there were
sometimes where Staff 1 would be in Youth A’s bedroom with the
door closed.
Documents Reviewed:
- Email from MDHHS Worker dated 05/06/2025- MDHHS
Worker reported she has reached out to Law Enforcement,
and they will be dismissing the case from a criminal end.
- Note found in Youth A’s room signed by Staff 1- This
note was found by Staff 2 in Youth A’s room. The note
stated for Youth A to have a great weekend and to
remember that he is cared for and loved. This note
continues to provide words of encouragement to Youth A
and reminds him to use his coping skills. The note then
states “I will see you for dinner, wear your best outfit and I
will wear mine.” This note was signed with heart and Staff
1’s name.
- Youth A’s school email account- Eleven emails were
found between the dates of 03/12/2024 to 04/14/2024
where Staff 1 is communicating on her personal email to
Youth A’s school email. Within the emails it notes Youth A
asking for permission to go on outings, asking Staff 1 to
buy him a game, and Staff 1 encouraging him to have a
good day. Staff 1 did provide Youth A with her personal
phone number on 04/09/2055 when she was terminated
from the facility. She continued to have communication with
him till 4/16/2025 where she encouraged him to make
positive choices and to talk with his Foster Care Worker.
Staff 1 did provide Youth A with his log information for a
game he played on her tablet.
- Facility Code of Ethics Policy with a review date of
11/13/24- This policy notes how staff have the ethical
responsibility to the youth they serve and will ensure ethical
care practices and ethical business practices. One-point
notes within this policy that staff will maintain appropriate
boundaries with a client. This point goes on to state that
staff will not venture into a social relationship that has the
potential to distort or minimize the therapeutic interactions
experience between staff and the youth.
9

- Facility Staff Gifting Policy- Personal gifting to residents
is not permitted without the Executive Firector approval in
specific circumstances.
- Human Resource File for Staff 1- Staff 1 up to date with
all required trainings. She had completed the Code of
Ethics training on 10/09/2024 and Trauma Bond with a
Healthy relationship on 3/12/2025. Staff 1 had two
disciplinary actions noted within her Human Resource File:
o Verbal Warning on 04/09/2025 for inappropriate
boundaries- This warning noted on 03/23/2025 the
facility was made aware Staff 1 was going into a
youths room at night with the lights off and the door
ajar. Administrator 1 reviewed video footage and it
was found Staff 1 was in this youth’s room for 20
minutes with the door ajar. On 03/25/2025, Staff 1
again was in the same youth’s room with the lights
off and door slightly ajar. Administrator 3 held an
informal coaching with Staff 1 on 03/26/2025 and
reviewed the topics of practicing safe and
appropriate boundaries, appropriate interactions,
and staying on camera. Staff 1 appeared to have
taken the information well and stated, “I will work on
not being in his room at night.” On 03/31/25, it was
again reported that Staff 1 was in the same youth’s
room again with the lights off and video footage
confirmed this. Staff 1 was then provided with the
verbal warning and was scheduled to attend a
mandatory training on 04/16/2025 for professional
boundaries. She was placed on a safety plan
specifically for this youth and would not be working
one on one with this youth.
o Termination on 04/09/2025- Staff 1 was ultimately
terminated on 04/09/2025 due to inappropriate
boundaries. The report notes on April 8, 2025,
Administrator 2 had concerns that one of the youth
was given an unauthorized personal staff tablet that
was not being monitored. Administrator 2 had talked
with Staff 1 about this concern, and she admitted
that she had hid the table in her pants and gave it to
the youth in question. Upon review of the
10

applications on the tablet, it was observed the youth
had access to discord and that multiple calls had
been made, along with a picture being take.
Additionally, the youth had access to a game that
was rated 17 and above.
Analysis The facility is found in violations of Staff 1 not following the code of
ethics policy with Youth A. There were findings within interviews
and documentation that Staff 1 would go into Youth A’s bedroom
with the door shut and was sending him emails to Youth A school
emails on her personal email. Staff 1 was also writing notes to
Youth A which blurs the lines of professional boundaries.
Consultation
Consultation was provided to make a specific policy about staff
going into a youth’s bedroom and about writing notes to the youth.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2023C0000601 dated 08/15/2023, CAP approved 08/30/23
SIR2023C0000544 dated 07/20/2023, CAP approved 08/15/23
SIR2023C0000538 dated 06/13/2023, CAP approved 08/09/23
SIR2023C0000673SI dated 09/21/2023, CAP approved 10/18/23
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
June 13, 2025
